comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2622) (MYAIR-3444)
# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2623) (MYAIR-3374)
# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.
# Note: When Monte Carlo is in foreground and a push notification is received, the push will NOT show up in system tray; it will only result in the push's associated navigation tab being badged.
# Note: For android use this command to get the Token = adb logcat -v time | grep Refreshed
# Note: For android use this command to get the AccountIdentifier = adb logcat -v time | egrep AccountIdentifier
#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-3528) (MCA-2521)
# 1. When App receives a push notification, regardless if App is in foreground or background, then a badge shall be shown on the App launch icon.
# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

# Note: When App is in the background and a push notification is received the push notification details are displayed in the system tray.  When a user opens the App, regardless if opened by App Icon or system tray push notification, the App Icon badge is removed and all system tray push notifications are cleared (i.e. no longer outstanding)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings
existing badge icon on "Dashboard" tab has been removed
existing badge icon on "Coaching" tab has been removed

elements.name: Verify the badge icon appears over the coaching tab following a "Coaching tip" push notification when on the dashboard, and removed when navigating to the "Coaching" screen

steps.name: I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
a "CoachingTip" push notification is received
I should see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab
I tap the "Coaching" tab
I should be on the "Coaching" screen
I should not see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2622) (MYAIR-3444)
# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2623) (MYAIR-3374)
# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.
# Note: When Monte Carlo is in foreground and a push notification is received, the push will NOT show up in system tray; it will only result in the push's associated navigation tab being badged.
# Note: For android use this command to get the Token = adb logcat -v time | grep Refreshed
# Note: For android use this command to get the AccountIdentifier = adb logcat -v time | egrep AccountIdentifier
#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-3528) (MCA-2521)
# 1. When App receives a push notification, regardless if App is in foreground or background, then a badge shall be shown on the App launch icon.
# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

# Note: When App is in the background and a push notification is received the push notification details are displayed in the system tray.  When a user opens the App, regardless if opened by App Icon or system tray push notification, the App Icon badge is removed and all system tray push notifications are cleared (i.e. no longer outstanding)

# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.

# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.

# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

name: Show badge icon when new data is received from patient portal or from coaching tip push notification

elements.name: Verify when Monte Carlo receives 500 server error on My nofifications, MC will inform user that server error occurred and user is able to dismissthe error message.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Profile" screen
Patient Portal will send an HTTP "500"
I navigate to the "My notifications" screen
I should see the "Server Error" dialog
I'm able to dismiss the "Server Error" dialog
I tap the "Back" button
I should be on the "Profile Settings" screen

name: App Deprecation and Server Error from Patient Portal

elements.name: The user does not have an internet connection and tries to access "Terms of Use" screen

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "About app" screen
I enable airplane mode
I tap the "Terms of Use" button
I should see the "Connection error" dialog
I tap the "OK" button
I should be on the "Terms of Use" screen
I tap the "Back" button
I should be on the "About app" screen

I open the app on the "About app" screen
I enable airplane mode
I tap the "Privacy Notice" button
I should see the "Connection error" dialog
I tap the "OK" button
I should be on the "Privacy Notice" screen
I tap the "Back" button
I should be on the "About app" screen

elements.name: Patient Portal Server does not respond when user tries to update equipment info in "Update machine" screen

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Update machine" screen
I enter "56221828959" into the "Serial number" field
I enter "564" into the "Device number" field
Patient Portal requests will time out
I tap the "Save" button
I should see the "Server error" dialog

elements.name: Patient Portal Server does not respond when user tries to sync the dashboard

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Profile" screen
Patient Portal requests will time out
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I tap the "Dashboard" button
I should see the "Server error" dialog

name: No internet or Patient Portal Connection

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRTIERIA: (MCA-2964) (MYAIR-3774)
#  1. The patient shall be able to enable and disable email coaching notifications.
#  2. The patient shall be able to enable and disable SMS coaching notifications.
#  3. The patient shall be able to enable and disable push coaching notifications.
#  4. The patient shall be able to enable and disable email cleaning reminder notifications.
#  5. The patient shall be able to enable and disable SMS cleaning reminder notifications.
#  6. The patient shall be able to enable and disable push cleaning reminder notifications.

#  7. If SMS notifications are turned on and the user does not have a phone number in their profile, the user shall be required to enter a phone number (note: see MYAIR-1287/MCA-701 for phone number confirmation requirements)
# Note 1 :  All test scenarios in this feature file require using Patient Portal server
# Note 2 : "More" screen for iOS is similar to "Settings" screen for android
# Note 3 : "Verify" screen for iOS is similar to "VERIFY" screen for android
# For Cleaning Reminders
# Note 4: The account for this test should have a Phone Number associated with the account
# Note 5: Reference page for Cleaning reminders: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Push%2C+Coaching+Tips+and+Library
# Note 6: Reference page for Cleaning reminders of notification settings: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/myAir+Notification+Settings
# Note 7: Cleaning Reminders - how to trigger events - https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MYAIR/Cleaning+and+replacement+reminders

elements.name: Verify that the user is able to enable and disable Email and SMS Coaching notifications on "My notifications" screen.

steps.name: I open the app on the "My notifications" screen
I toggle the "Email coaching" switch off
I toggle the "SMS coaching" switch off
I see "Email coaching" is turned off
I see "SMS coaching" is turned off
I toggle the "Email coaching" switch on
I toggle the "SMS coaching" switch on
I see "Email coaching" is turned on
I see "SMS coaching" is turned on

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-167)(MYAIR-2946)
#  1. The user shall be able to view the serial number of the FG in their account
#  2. The user shall be able to view the model name of the FG in their account
#  3. The user shall be able to view the manufacturer of the FG in their account
# Note: Validation code reference:  https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Patient+Portal#PatientPortal-Validatedeviceinformation
# For serial and device numbers combination for testing MYAIR-1530:
# | AC            | Validation Code | Serial Number | Device Number |
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2536) (MYAIR-3002)
# 1. If the user has an AirSense in their account, then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine that is provided by Patient Portal
# 2. In the event Patient Portal returns last sync time as "1900-01-01T00:00:00.000Z" then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine as "-"
# Note: By default the App displays "-" for last sync time (i.e. sync has yet to occur).
# Note 1:  All test scenarios in this feature file require using Patient Portal server
# Note 2 : "More" screen is for iOS and for android is "Settings"

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

comments.value: # Note: Patient portal will sync up when user goes to the dashboard (on Log in user goes to the dashboard)

I wait for data sync
I navigate to the "My equipment" screen
I wait for network sync
I see last synced local time

# 3.  The App shall allow the patient to set their location of sleep test as either: Home, Sleep lab, or Both

I should see the "Registration events each hour" field
I should see the "Registration sleep test location" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-502) (MYAIR-1060)
# 1. If the user is logged in, actioning a notification will open Monte Carlo to the appropriate screen
# 2. If the user is not logged in, they shall be moved to the login screen (note: default login action after logging in)
# 3. If the user actions a Coaching Push notification, the coaching section shall be updated
# Note 1: See https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Push%2C+Coaching+Tips+and+Library for details
# Note 2: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user
# IMPORTANT: need a clean install of the App

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings

elements.name: When user is logged in, opening notification will open appropriate type screen

I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
Push notifications are enabled
the app is in the background
a "ScoreTip" push notification is received with body "When it's night, you've been shining bright. Your consistent therapy use has been excellent!"

I should be on the "Dashboard" screen

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: When user navigates to Dashboard from Profile screen, the default sleep record displayed is last night's sleep record.

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I navigate to 2 sleep records back
I navigate to the "Profile" screen
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I see the score for most recent sleep record

name: Sleep Record Navigation and display default sleep record
